page.title: 20Transport
page.content: As no cars are allowed in Clovelly's main street ,people use{sledges}to bring their shopping home. Milk is delivered every morning by sledge and weekly coal deliveries are made firstly by tractor and then by sledge.There are 10{donkeys}who carry rubbish bags and visitors' cases up from the New Inn.In the Winter, village children ride the donkeys. In the Summer any children can have rides in the top field. There is also a steep{back-road}down to the Quay. Landrovers take tourists up and down for 35 p. each.They are also used to bring deliveries down to The Red Lion and to take empty bottles and sledges back up.There are several{buses}to Hartland & Bideford daily & a bus to Plymouth every 3rd. Saturday in the summer.Most people shop in Bideford by car.
